Call Recording       Call Information The zoom waiting room will be on, and a password is set to: 748478; please ping us in the Maker Discord’s #governance channel if you aren’t let in from the waiting room. 2021-12-15T17:00:00Z  Video/Voice  Dial-in  Calls Calendar  Slides, updated before the call  Introduction   @GovAlpha-Core-Unit - Hosting, Introduction, Agenda.  @gov-comms-core-unit - Slides   Governance Round-Up   @GovAlpha-Core-Unit - Votes Recap  @MIP-Editors - MIPs Recap  @Artem_Gordon - Forum Recap   Initiative Update  Maker Transaction Level Accounting Dashboard by @strat-fin-core-unit   Selected Discussion   Main Topic RWA Monitoring; Short intro to MIP13c3-SP13: Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults & discussion Discussion about MIP55c3-SP13 : Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster, author will not be able to make the call. Ask us stuff  Anonymous question box   @Recognized-Delegates @Core-Facilitators

Davidutro:  Discussion about MIP55c3-SP13 : Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster, author will not be able to make the call.   Maybe let’s postpone this topic, then? We’ve already seen in the past that it makes little sense to have this type of discussion if the author is not there.

The next topic with the most votes is MIP93: Utilizing Hats Protocol, which doesn’t have much feedback or buzz around it. Perhaps if the RWA monitoring discussion doesn’t have much engagement we can switch over to that. As a general topic though, I think there’s a lot of info out there and it might be valuable to hear what @Recognized-Delegates are for, what they are against, and what they envision for the future on this front. For example, The Viridian Cluster SPF not only monitors the Monetalis RWAs, but also funds the due diligence, completion, and ongoing management. Concerns have been raised about the conflict of interest since members of viridian are doing all of this on their own deals–is there a desire to design it so protectorDAOs cross-monitor deals? Should the creditor be paying for these services? These are super important questions that would be valuable to riff on regardless if the author of the proposal is present. That’s my thinking  Given that there’s not a good alternative topic, I will keep this one and we can end early if there’s not much engagement.

Episode #217: December 1st, 2022 | Editorial  Agenda   0:00: Introduction  2:52: Votes and Polls  4:44: MIPs Update  9:31: Weekly Forum Recap  16:17: Initiative: TechOps Q&A   50:48: Initiative: CES Team Update   1:00:40: Initiative: ETHGathering Outcomes   1:04:00: Discussion: Existential Exposure & Mitigation    Video Link  General Updates  Votes  Payton Rose 2:52 Visit: Voting Portal  Votes:   Polls – 3:03   Executive Proposals – 3:38     MIPs  Gala 4:44 Visit: Weekly MIPs Update #115 & MakerDAO Votes and Polls Public Calendar Important Dates: New proposals must be posted by Wednesday, December 7th, at the latest, to be eligible for the next monthly cycle.  Ratification Polls:   Top-Level MIPs – 5:09   Core Unit Budgets – 5:48   Miscellaneous – 6:21     Proposals in RFC:   All – 6:58     Weekly Forum Recap  Artem Gordon 9:31  Visit: Weekly Forum Recap: November 24th - November 30th, 2022  Video: Link  News & Announcements:  Moving 30th Nov and 7th Dec Executives to Friday of each week Fallback Interim Facilitator Selection Process - CES-001 Attention RENBTC-A Users: Collateral Offboarding MIP4c2-SP30: Amend Interim Facilitator Appointment Process    Discussion:  A Better Prioritization System for MakerDAO Discussion on Existential Exposure and Mitigation    Discussion  Initiative: TechOps Q&A   Dumitru 16:17  Contents:   Team – 17:04   Mandate – 18:48   Responsibilities – 19:51   Infrastructure – 21:11   Keepers/Monitoring – 22:38   Blockchain Nodes – 24:37   Alerts and Notifications – 25:13   Analytics Dashboards – 26:28     2023 Plan - Transition to Endgame – 28:16   TechOps CU Contacts – 30:37     Q&A 31:47   Frank Cruz: Can you describe how you send notifications to large vault holders getting liquidated? Is the monitoring dashboard you showed us public or private?  36:51   Frank Cruz: Why do you believe it would be more efficient for TechOps to run the MakerDAO forum as opposed to another CU?  39:03   David Utrobin: How would you respond to the accusation of TechOps double-dipping by charging CUs for various services while also having a budget?  42:45   Simon: I will return to Frank’s question about managing the forum. Having a globally-composed team is an advantage over other CUs; we can keep a continuous flux of work to offer constant troubleshooting for whatever arises in the forum just by having people living in various time zones at a time.  44:29   Santiago Botto: Some people have mentioned that a lot of the work in infrastructure that TechOps is doing for other CUs could be managed by themselves. They could, but are the workers willing to do the extra research and work? Typically, this can result in low morale and, most likely, in asking for bigger budgets to hire more people to do the job. I would recommend developers focus on something other than infrastructure or vice versa.  46:48   Frank Cruz: How in tune is TechOps with the Endgame Plan, budget-wise?   Discussion  Initiative: CES Team Update   Retro 50:48  Contents:   Interim Facilitator Focus – 51:15   Work requirements, timelines and deliverables – 53:38     Q&A 55:14   Frank Cruz: Regarding MIP81, is CES still considering working on a smart contract?  58:49   Retro: To answer Tim’s question about the Interim Facilitator term, the MIP recommends two months, although we hope to have a concrete timeline towards the end of December. CES has funding approved through April 1st, which will afford us a timeline to prepare for the proper transition to an Endgame-ready team.   Discussion  Initiative: ETHGathering Outcomes   Tadeo 1:00:40  Contents:   Overview – 1:01:07   UNFUZZ Endgame by Deniz – 1:02:18     Q&A 1:03:13   Tadeo: To Schuppi’s comment about redoing this in Denver, that is a good point. We should have more information and developments by then, and I should be able to work through any topics that might still need to be fully fleshed out.   Discussion  Discussion: Existential Exposure & Mitigation   Hexonaut, Risk CU & Others 1:04:00  Contents:   Preamble – 1:04:31   Defining “Existencial Exposure” – 1:05:36   Key Ideas – 1:08:22     Q&A 1:10:37   Raphael: Apparently, our current reporting on the state of debt is complicated. It is necessary to level up in that regard. How confident are you in the RWA monitoring?  1:12:30   Brian: The original plan for Maker’s system was for MKR holders to take losses. Generally, the system should be risk-managed to cover any losses and, if not, to be able to do so with MKR sales. Taking a 500M DAI hit right now translates into putting a 10% hole in DAI value.  We cannot cover that with the Surplus Buffer. The next step would be to sell MKR to recover that loss, and a chain of side effects would come from that. Given a crisis in confidence in the DAI backing, our traditional vault-holders will leave, the PSMs will quickly drain, and that 10% hole that we had can rapidly become much larger.  That takes the risk off MKR holders and puts it on DAI holders. Lacking a better term, in crypto, we call that a rug-pull. In the last few months, we have seen the collapses of FTX, Blockfi, and Celsius. It only takes one of these secondary counterparties of us to fail. As Sam said before, we need a plan for this.      1:17:04   Payton Rose: With the implementation of the Endgame Plan, all of the RWA lendings will happen through Protector MetaDAOs, which should have a first-loss junior position setting up a revenue stream for taking on first losses.   Frank Cruz: As an example, if Viridian, managing MIP65 on behalf of the DAO, shifted that MIP to their Cluster and eventually something went wrong, that first hit should be covered by the MetaDAO and the Core, MKR token holders, would not be affected?    1:21:37   Justin: MKR holders should be at risk should anything fail. Moreover, that is why it is fundamental to ensure that the MKR token carries and increases in value so that we can bear more risk on the token itself.  We have to grow the Surplus Buffer. To do that, we are in a situation where we have to take on extra risk because we are in a negative profit scenario. Everything is connected; all of the initiatives for reducing expenses while increasing revenue are pulling us in the right direction.  We need to find ways to minimize existential risk. To me, that means any loss in excess of the Surplus Buffer. That puts us in a situation where DAI holders take the cut unless we can make up the shortfall with MKR tokens, which we cannot do unless we maintain a certain value.      1:23:54   Sam: As a next step, we should define a number for existential exposure, and that should be more complex than saying that it is a number higher than the Surplus Buffer. Not differentiating between 5 Million and 5 Billion in exposure is a mistake.  Suggestion Box  Credits  Andrea Suarez produced this summary. Kunfu-po produced this summary. Constanza produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call.
